Description: 20 fragments from the rim and side of a blown glass bowl; colourless with polychrome design; rim outsplayed and knocked off; lip ground smooth; sides convex; bottom missing; at rim a frieze of up (red) and down (yellow) triangles, each with three white dots within, and the red ones bordered all around with white; no upper border line; black outlines; design painted on outside in unfired colours without a covering.
Bibliographic references: Daniels et al 2014 / Technological insights into madder pigment production in antiquity (p.18, table.1)
